More Information On Their Events

The AKJ Associates Group has been organizing private networking events for top Information Risk & Security stakeholders and service providers from across the world for more than two decades.

For more than 20 years, AKJ Associates has specialized in linking information security stakeholders and service providers to help organizations and enterprises throughout the world handle security, compliance, and risk management concerns.

Their portfolio is concentrated on information security, data protection, regulatory compliance, fraud, payment risk, and the PCI DSS.

They also organize bespoke private meetings. These are designed to share particular security expertise and solutions with top security decision-makers. Their belief is that customized round-table meetings are the most efficient and effective method available. With the Chatham House Rule in place, these high-­value, closed-­door events foster good networking among important stakeholders, allowing invited guests to obtain deep insights into current areas of concern and potential solutions to address those areas.

As a delegate, you will be presented with cutting-edge security solutions, case studies, and best practices from hand-picked specialists, as well as the opportunity to expand your peer-to-peer network. Their current portfolio is focused on data security, data protection, regulatory compliance, fraud, payment risk, and the PCI DSS.

They now offer events centered on the following security topics:

e-Crime & Cybersecurity
PCI DSS
Securing Financial Services
Securing the Law Firm
Securing Online Gaming

e-Crime & Cybersecurity Congress in Abu Dhabi 2022

They all require cybersecurity, which will be discussed at the 12th e-Crime & Cybersecurity Congress in Abu Dhabi. Join them for their in-depth technical seminars and real-world case studies from the security and privacy teams of some of the most respected businesses in the world.

From cyberwar to cybercrime:

The (in)security landscape has changed as a result of blurred borders between cyberspies, cybercriminals, and cybercrimes. Nation-state exploits are now readily accessible.
How can the various branches of government more effectively collaborate with end users, private sector solution providers, and non-nation-state adversaries to create security that can withstand them?

e-Crime & Cybersecurity Congress Switzerland 2022

We all require a new type of security, which will be discussed at the first e-Crime & Cybersecurity Congress Switzerland. Join us for our in-depth technical seminars and real-world case studies from the security and privacy teams of some of the most respected businesses in the world.

Can one get zero trust?

The acronyms Zero Trust/ZTNA/SASE promise solutions to the major issues CISOs are now dealing with.
How realistic are they, though? Do they consider legacy technology that is already in use and the day-to-day operations of actual businesses?
Can you describe how a practical implementation operates?

e-Crime & Cybersecurity Mid-Year Summit 2022

We all require a new type of security, which will be discussed at the 14th e-Crime & Cybersecurity Mid-Year Summit. Join us for our in-depth technical seminars and real-world case studies from the security and privacy teams of some of the most respected businesses in the world.

Hackers will continue to elude antiquated control frameworks unless cybersecurity is really regarded as risk management and not a whack-a-mole IT problem.
CISOs, boards, and solution suppliers are all responsible for a portion of this.
Banks have carried it out. When will the company as a whole catch up?

Annual e-Crime & Cybersecurity Congress Spain 2022

Around 40 day-long events are offered annually by AKJ Associates to a variety of regional and industry-specific markets.

London, Abu Dhabi, Amsterdam, Dubai, Frankfurt, Madrid, Munich, Paris, and Stockholm are among the locations. 5,529 senior decision-makers came to our events last year.

As a delegate, you will expand your peer-to-peer network while learning about cutting-edge security solutions, case studies, and best practices from hand-picked experts. The PCI DSS, fraud, regulatory compliance, data protection, and information security are the main topics of our present offering.

The following security-related events are being offered by AKJ Associates at the moment:

e-Crime & Cybersecurity
PCI DSS
Securing Financial Services
Securing the Law Firm
Securing Online Gaming

24th PCI London 2023

PCI DSS 4.0 is more than just an update to a standard dedicated to protecting a few digits of a PAN. It places new emphasis on risk analysis and organizational governance; it has significant implications for client-side security; and it includes brand new requirements for how businesses identify, inventory, and manage scripts that collect payment information in web browsers.

Compliance activities are no longer restricted to once a year but are now required on a continuous basis. Additionally, organizations will be required to produce more security documentation. In addition, regular QSA assessments will increase the scrutiny placed on PCI 4.0 activities.

Requirement 6.4.1 states that new threats and vulnerabilities are addressed on an ongoing basis for public-facing web applications and that these applications are protected from known attacks.

Requirement 6.4.3 states, among other things, that an inventory of scripts must be kept, with written justification for why each script is required, and that a method must be put in place to ensure the integrity of each script.

Requirement 12 broadens the scope of compliance and makes compliance continuous, rather than just a single point in time. It also requires merchants and service providers to conduct annual reviews of hardware and software technologies in use, as well as plans for updating outdated technologies.

These examples from the new standard demonstrate that, if followed, PCI DSS 4.0 provides far more than simple compliance on a limited set of payment data. It lays the groundwork for securing a modern business in an e-commerce-driven, digital world.

Firms, however, will need to change their mindset in order to achieve compliance. The customized approach, enhanced validation methods and procedures, and some other elements of the new standard are novel, and some are incompatible with current QSA validation methods.

Join other professionals in London on January 25th to learn from a combination of technical presentations, case studies, and interactive panels, as well as to reconnect with old friends and colleagues and make new contacts. And then join us for a drink.

This will be our first face-to-face event since the pandemic, and we are thrilled to be launching it at a time when the Standard has been renewed, and possibly transformed, into a security and privacy template for the modern, digitally-enabled business.

e-Crime & Cybersecurity Congress UK 2023

At this year’s e-Crime & Cybersecurity Conference, we will be discussing the necessity of a new type of security for all of us. Participate in the security and privacy teams of some of the most well-known and respected brands in the world as they present real-life case studies and in-depth technical workshops.

Around 40 one-day events are provided by AKJ Associates on an annual basis, catering to a variety of local and industry-specific vertical markets.

The cities of London, Abu Dhabi, Amsterdam, Dubai, Frankfurt, Madrid, Munich, Paris, and Stockholm are among those that are represented. During the prior year, there were 5,529 senior-level decision-makers present at their events.

When expanding your peer-to-peer network as a delegate, you will receive cutting-edge security solutions, case studies, and best practices from professionals who have been carefully selected. Information security, data protection, regulatory compliance, fraud, payments risk, and the PCI Data Security Standard are currently the primary focuses of their business.

At this time, they provide events that are centered on topics related to the following types of security:

e-Crime & Cybersecurity
PCI DSS
Securing Financial Services

More Information On Their Events

The Linux Foundation is a nonprofit technology consortium that was established in the year 2000 as a result of the merger between Open Source Development Labs and the Free Standards Group. Its primary goals are to standardize Linux, support its growth, and encourage its adoption in commercial settings.

Open Source Summit North America 2022

The Open Source Summit is the premier event for open source developers, technologists, and community leaders to come together to cooperate, exchange information, solve issues, and gain knowledge in order to advance open source innovation and ensure a healthy open source ecosystem. It serves as a central hub for open-source code and the community members that contribute to it.

The Open Source Summit is an umbrella conference that encompasses a set of events that are devoted to discussing the most significant technologies, themes, and problems that are currently relevant to open source.

KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2022

The flagship conference of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation will take place in Detroit, Michigan from October 24 through October 28, 2022. Attendees will include adapters and technicians from prominent open-source and cloud-native groups.

Join containerd, CoreDNS, Envoy, etcd, Fluentd, Harbor, Helm, Jaeger, Kubernetes, Linkerd, Open Policy Agent, Prometheus, Rook, TiKV, TUF, Vitess, Argo, Buildpacks, Cilium, CloudEvents, CNI, Contour, Cortex, CRI-O, Crossplane, dapr, Dragonfly, Emissary Ingress, Falco, Flagger, Flux, gRPC, KEDA, KubeEdge, Litmus, Longhorn, NATS, Notary, OpenTelemetry, Operator Framework, SPIFFE, SPIRE, and Thanos as the community gathers for five days to further the education and advancement of cloud native computing.

Embedded IoT Summit Latin America 2022

At the Embedded IoT Summit, system architects, firmware developers, and software developers who are working on resource-constrained embedded and Internet of Things solutions may learn from one another and interact in order to boost the development velocity and achieve maximum innovation.

Embedded IoT Summit topics include:

Best Practices Working with Resource Constraints

Code Footprint Minimization
Sensor Interaction
Power Usage
Open Hardware Support
Hardware/Software Tradeoffs for Acceleration Technologies

Cybersecurity & Safety Considerations for Systems not based on Linux

Best Practices for Handling Vulnerabilities in Open Source Projects
Secure Bootloaders and Trusted Update Support
Secure Communication to the Edge
Considerations for Use in Sandboxes and Non-Linux Virtualization
Best Practices for Determining the Scope of Edge Autonomy

Outside World Meets IoT RTOSes

NTP and Synchronization
Connected Sensors
EMF/RFI Impact
Real-Time Considerations
Communication Technologies

CloudOpen 2022

CloudOpen delivers excellent content across cloud-native and cloud infrastructure technologies. This is the place where cloud developers, engineers, and operations teams can learn about new tools, projects, platforms, and technologies that are applicable to cloud-native and cloud-based infrastructures.

Open Cloud Infrastructure
Hybrid & Multicloud
Edge Cloud Computing
Container-Native Virtualization
Container and Infrastructure Security
Cloud Native Storage
Infrastructure-as-Code
CI/CD, Configuration Management

LFX Mentorship Showcase 2023

The LFX Mentorship Showcase is an event that provides graduating mentees of the LFX Mentorship program with the opportunity to exhibit the work that they have done during the course of their session term.

This online event is open to anyone who is interested in learning more about the experiences of LF Mentorship Program mentees, discovering more information about some of the programs our projects are working on, recruiting new talent, and supporting new developer contributions. Attendance is free, and anyone can participate in the event.

Developers, many of whom are making their first contribution to an open-source project, can benefit from the knowledge and experience gained through the Linux Foundation’s Mentorship Program. These developers are better able to contribute to open-source communities.

CloudNativeSecurityCon North America 2023

CloudNativeSecurityCon is a two-day event aimed at encouraging collaboration, discussion, and knowledge sharing about cloud-native security projects and how to best use them to address security challenges and opportunities. The goal is not simply to propose incremental improvements to what has come before but to make room for breakthrough technology and advances in modern security approaches. Architecture and policy, secure software development, supply chain security, identity and access, forensics, and other topics will be covered in sessions and lightning talks presented by expert practitioners.

CloudNativeSecurityCon attendees come to learn from one another and delve deep into topics such as architecture and policy, secure software development, supply chain security, identity and access, forensics, and more.

The Linux Foundation Legal Summit 2023

The Linux Foundation Legal Summit is a neutral legal forum where leading attorneys from businesses that use open-source solutions can collaborate to focus on and discuss issues of mutual interest and concern. The Linux Foundation’s Platinum, Gold, and Silver members are invited to send legal counsel to The Linux Foundation Legal Summit.

Academy Software Foundation (ASWF) Open Source Forum 2023

The Academy Software Foundation (ASWF) Open Source Forum is an annual event that brings together business and technical leaders to exchange ideas, insights, and experiences to drive the future of open-source software across the motion picture and media industries. This event is organized by the Academy Software Foundation (ASWF).

Automotive Grade Linux All Member Meeting Spring 2023

The Automotive Grade Linux (AGL) All Member Meeting is held twice a year and brings together members of the AGL community so that they can collaborate on driving rapid innovation throughout the industry, discuss the best practices that have been developed, and learn about the most recent advancements in the field.

Cassandra Summit 2023

The Cassandra Summit brings the industry together to share best practices and use cases, celebrate makers and users, forge critical relationships, and learn about advancements in Apache Cassandra and the ecosystem that drives today’s open-source data infrastructure. It is the world’s largest gathering of members of the Apache Cassandra community, including architects, developers, users, and industry thought leaders.

Connect with thousands of database influencers and learn everything there is to know about Apache Cassandra, the massively scalable open-source NoSQL distributed database that powers global companies like Instagram, Netflix, Adobe, and Target.

Join us for a two-day event filled with hands-on labs, sessions, and the essential hallway track. There are also numerous opportunities to create community memories in a festival-like setting. Stay tuned for more exciting news!

Cassandra Summit 2023 will be a vendor-neutral conference organized by the Linux Foundation’s events team.

AGL at eEmbedded World 2023

Automobile Grade Linux, sometimes known as AGL, is a community-driven open-source project that is hastening the creation of a completely open software platform tailored specifically to the needs of automotive applications.

Attend Embedded World 2023 with other industry professionals to hear presenters discuss the AGL ecosystem in its broadest context and its members.

RISC-V at Embedded World 2023

Join the team at embedded world 2023, March 14-16, 2023, in Nuremberg, Germany, as they bring the community together to demonstrate the power of open collaboration on innovation, product success across the ecosystem, and the technical strength of RISC-V.

RISC-V is a global standard that is available under a royalty-free open license.

Powered by open collaboration
Providing design freedom across domains and industries
Solidifying semiconductors’ strategic foundation

KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2023

The flagship conference of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation will convene adopters and technologists from prominent open source and cloud native communities in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, from April 18-21, 2023.

cdCon + GitOpsCon 2023

By bringing two communities together, cdCon + GitOpsCon hopes to stimulate collaboration, conversation, and information exchange. It is the ideal venue for providers and end users to work together to shape the future of GitOps and Continuous Delivery (CD).

This event is intended for both new and experienced GitOps and CD users. Learn from seasoned practitioners about dangers to avoid, challenges to overcome, and how to use the most popular open-source GitOps and CD technologies in your cloud-native environment, including Argo, Flux, Tekton, Jenkins, Spinnaker, and CDEvents.

Linux Storage, Filesystem, MM & BPF Summit 2023

The Linux Storage, Filesystem, Memory Management, and BPF Summit brings together the top development and research experts, as well as kernel subsystem maintainers, to plan and implement improvements to the Linux filesystem, storage, and memory management subsystems that will make their way into the mainline kernel and Linux distributions over the next 24-48 months.

Linux Security Summit North America 2023

The Linux Security Summit (LSS) is a technical event for collaboration among Linux developers, academics, and end users, with the primary goal of encouraging community efforts to examine and solve Linux security concerns.

LSS is a conference for Linux security community members and maintainers to present their work and discuss research with peers, as well as people who want to stay up to date on the latest in Linux security development and contribute input to the development process.

Open Source Summit North America 2023

The Open Source Summit is the premier event for open source developers, technologists, and community leaders to communicate, share information, solve problems, and gain knowledge, thereby advancing open source innovation and assuring the sustainability of the open source ecosystem. It serves as a hub for open-source code and community contributions.

The Open Source Summit is a conference umbrella that includes a number of events that cover the most relevant technologies, themes, and concerns affecting open source today.

R/Medicine 2023

Both the R/Medicine conference and community work to encourage the creation and utilization of R-based technologies for the purpose of enhancing clinical research and practice.

Embedded Open Source Summit 2023

The Embedded Open Source Summit (EOSS) is a new umbrella event that brings together open-source embedded projects and developer communities under one roof for critical cooperation and education.

The Embedded Linux Conference (ELC) is intended for businesses and developers who use Linux in embedded systems. It brings together technical professionals working on embedded systems and educational and collaborative applications, setting the way for transformation in these critical and far-reaching sectors.

Zephyr Developer Summit, which will be held in 2021, is intended for developers who use or are contemplating using Zephyr in embedded devices. This year, we will prioritize subjects of importance to Zephyr users, developers contributing upstream, and maintainer-specific topics.

Open Source Summit Europe 2023

Join the team at the premier event for open-source developers, technologists, and community leaders to cooperate, share information, solve problems, and gain knowledge, advancing open-source innovation and guaranteeing the long-term viability of the open-source ecosystem. It is THE hub for open-source code and community contributions.

Linux Security Summit Europe 2023

The Linux Security Summit (LSS) is a technical event for collaboration among Linux developers, academics, and end users, with the primary goal of encouraging community efforts to examine and solve Linux security concerns.

LSS is a gathering place for major Linux security community members and maintainers to present their work and discuss research with peers, as well as people who want to stay up to date on the latest in Linux security development and contribute input to the development process.

The Linux Foundation Member Summit 2023

Open source is pervasive in computing, with practically all significant firms relying on it to fuel their operations. Companies must learn directly from the senior technologists and thought leaders who guide the most extensively used and important initiatives in order to bring innovative products and services to their consumers and customers. The yearly gathering of Linux Foundation member organizations is known as the Linux Foundation Member Summit (previously Open Source Leadership Summit).

The event promotes collaboration, innovation, and collaboration among the premier projects and organizations driving digital transformation with open-source technologies. It is a must-attend event for business and technical leaders who want to promote open-source strategy, implementation, and investment in their organizations, as well as learn how to manage the largest shared technology investment of our time collectively.

KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2023

CloudNativeSecurityCon is a two-day event that promotes developer-first cloud-native security practices through cooperation, discussion, and information exchange.

The purpose is to bring together application developers and modern security specialists to propose solutions that do more than gradually improve on what has come before, but also to make place for cutting-edge projects and improvements in current security approaches. Architecture and policy, safe software development, supply chain security, identity and access, forensics, and other topics will be covered in sessions and lightning talks provided by professional practitioners.

More Information On Their Events

CISO 360 Asia & Oceania 2022

CISO 360 Asia & Oceania is a regional Conference that was designed and will be held by Pulse Conferences. The team will present the second edition of this event. CISOs, CTOs, CIOs, technology, risk, and governance practitioners, and executives from all around the APAC and Oceania area and further afield will once again meet in Singapore to benchmark their progress and discuss different methods to address cybersecurity threats.

Join us for an experience that is both fascinating and immersive, during which you, as a participant, will be given the time and space to debate and bond with other participants, as well as to have those complex conversations. Remember that someone in this room will have the solution to your most difficult problem, so take advantage of this fantastic opportunity to network with other CISOs so that you may discuss, learn from, and benchmark security goals.

Their international speaker panel will introduce leading CISOs from across the Asia and Oceania region, from around the world, and from across industry sectors to share their knowledge and experiences. This event will be led “by, with, and for CISO/CSOs,” and it will be attended by CISOs and CSOs from across all industry sectors. Participate in high-quality face-to-face and interactive engagement by becoming a member of this prominent and important group of C-suite and senior cybersecurity executives.

The program places an emphasis on leadership strategies and provides vital updates on the emerging opportunity and risk horizon, role expectations, and business technologies within the years to come. These technologies include artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), automation (AI), cloud (cloud computing), mobility (mobile computing), and security.

CISO 360 Middle East Conference 2023

The fact that Dubai will hold discussions with some of the most knowledgeable CISOs and cybersecurity figures worldwide pleases the organizers. The 4th CISO 360 Middle East, organized and hosted by Pulse Conferences, brings together CISOs and global cybersecurity professionals from the GCC area and beyond for intense conversations.

Be aware of threat horizon updates and a toolset-focused agenda created around CISO priorities as today’s CISOs march towards an uncertain future and uncharted cyberspace! An issue shared is an issue halved! To benefit from technological strategies and future outlooks, compare and discuss how other CISOs are managing teams and advancing their companies.

Flagship Global 7th CISO 360 Congress 2023

On the 5-7th of July, Barcelona, Spain, will host strategic discussions with some of the most knowledgeable individuals in the cybersecurity business from across the world!

The 7th CISO 360 Congress – hosted at the InterContinental Barcelona by Pulse Conferences – will bring together CISOs and international cybersecurity professionals to compare and share how they are managing teams and driving their organizations ahead, as well as their future aspirations. What is keeping CISOs awake at night? How is the CISO’s job evolving? What are the next changes we may anticipate?

We will get to know and question ideas through keynote lightning speeches, case studies, panels, think tanks, and fireside chats, as well as evening networking receptions, dinners, and a boat cruise. We will hear what plans CISOs are making, what motivates them, and where their travels are taking us as we assess cybersecurity strategies, methods, and tools with CISO peers and experience unparalleled learning and engagement. Throughout this two-and-a-half-day interactive event, travels, predictions and game changers span AI, IoT, metaverse, cloud, quantum computing, cyber geopolitics, supply chain, detection, response, and recovery, human security, culture, privacy, robots, and SOC.

Cyber Exchange 360: Talk to the Board 2023

Here is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to pose the questions you’d like to ask your own Board!

Guests are invited to join the 5th Cyber Exchange 360: Industry Sectors and Functional Board Roles from CEO, CMO, and HR. Speak to Pulse Conferences about the Board Conference, which will be held on November 8, 2023 in London, United Kingdom.

Our program offers a refreshing non-security viewpoint on cybersecurity, as well as a unique opportunity to speak candidly and test issues that participants would like to ask their own Board.

What skills, attitudes, and mindset are required to drive the security agenda in a stressed, complicated, and competitive corporate environment, and how can a culture be created in which cybersecurity is deemed core to how firms think and behave? Where does cybersecurity rank among the top Board risks and opportunities? What has changed in the last year, and what are the new CISO and security leader expectations?

CISO 360 Asia & Oceania Conference 2023

Pulse has created and will hold the 3rd CISO 360 Asia & Oceania Conference on September 26-27, 2023 in Singapore.

A fascinating and immersive experience, you will be given the time and space to discuss, bond, and have those nuanced dialogues with your peers. This is an excellent opportunity to engage, learn, and benchmark security goals with CISO colleagues – someone in this room will have the answer to your most difficult dilemma! This genuinely international speaker panel will span Singapore, the wider Asia and Oceania area, the UK/Europe, the US, and the Middle East, and will be led ‘by, with, and for’ CISOs and senior cybersecurity practitioners from across industry sectors. Leading CISOs have been chosen to offer their expertise and experiences. Join this significant C-suite and senior cybersecurity executive group for exceptional face-to-face and interactive interaction, learning, and networking.

You will learn:

Deep insights into what constitutes excellent security, as well as new expectations
CISOs’ perspective on key priorities

What’s included:

Lunches and evening networking plans to maximize your time with colleagues
Cross-industry approach
Discuss ideas beyond your tight circle
Improve your readiness to respond to a disaster by practicing scenario planning.

On roundtables, compare critical metrics, pain issues, and initiatives with CISO colleagues.

Get up to speed on the threat landscape, culture, and workforce.

Chief Security Officer 360 Congress 2023

This is a security event in Germany.

Against the backdrop of rapidly changing threat landscapes in geopolitical, technological, business, and economic spheres, this trust-based global community will reassemble to share tactics and strategies for the security, resilience, and sustainability of international business and government sectors.

A security agenda that is immersive, diversified, and integrated will reflect the developing backdrop of global volatility, uncertainty, complexity, and ambiguity. Attendees from all around the world will be motivated by their peers and will leave with new tools and ideas for taking positive action!

Evening networking events given by Pulse and its sponsors are an important part of the CSO 360 experience, ensuring that participants can continue to have those much-needed talks while seeing the host city!

During the two-and-a-half-day interactive program, hear adventures, predictions, and game-changers spanning geopolitics, supply chain, response and recovery, human security, culture, disinformation, climate risk, danger horizon, and mitigations – as well as breaking security headlines.

Governance 360 Africa 2023

3 full days of exciting events! There will be a variety of keynote talks, debates on current issues, practical application corporate case studies, and workshops to improve capacity.

More than 30 speakers hailing from all over the world, including Africa, Europe/UK, the United States, Asia, the Middle East, and other regions, have been handpicked for the unique perspectives they will bring to the table, and they have been tasked with providing profound insights into what good security looks like and what the new expectation is.

Executives, officials, technologists, investors, practitioners, entrepreneurs, and innovators share their insights on cybercrime, governance, and resilience-building initiatives.

CISO 360 Americas Conference 2023

Pulse Conferences is excited to announce that the third year of the CISO 360 Americas Conferences will be held in person on March 28, 2023, in New York, and October 18, 2023, in San Francisco! The two conferences will emphasize excellent face-to-face interaction, providing attendees with the time and space to discuss and bond with peers within a targeted format.

This is an excellent opportunity to participate, learn, and benchmark security goals with CISO colleagues. Their worldwide speaker panel led ‘by, with, and for’ CISO/CSOs from various industry sectors, will introduce renowned CISOs from the United States and throughout the world to exchange expertise and experiences. You are cordially invited to join this elite group of C-suite and senior cybersecurity leaders.

CISO 360 Americas emphasizes genuine face-to-face engagement, providing participants with the time and space to argue and bond with colleagues within a structured format.

More Information On Their Events

Gartner provides CEOs and their teams with practical, objective intelligence. Their professional advice and tools help organizations make quicker, smarter decisions and perform better on their most crucial goals.

Their unrivaled blend of expert-led, practitioner-sourced, and data-driven research guides clients to the best conclusions on the most important challenges. They are a trusted adviser and unbiased resource for over 14,000 organizations in over 100 countries – across all main functions, industries, and organizational sizes.

Gartner Security & Risk Management Summit 2022

Enterprises are rapidly adopting digitalization and agile processes, altering their risk profiles considerably. As a result, many businesses continue to build layers of defense, increasing the difficulty of fighting against the assault of increasingly sophisticated attacks. Your security approach must develop as you reframe your present thinking and simplify your procedures, organization, and protections.

At Gartner Security & Risk Management Summit 2022, join Gartner experts and your peers to learn about key strategic imperatives like establishing an agile security program, fostering a human-centric, security-conscious culture, devolving risk ownership, and establishing a new simplified Cybersecurity Mesh Architecture. It will allow you to protect your company, defend against attackers, and provide commercial value.

Gartner IT Symposium/XPO 2022

More than ever, CIOs and IT leaders are expected to add value to their companies. IT executives are expected to give firms a competitive edge, particularly in uncertain times, by realizing the promise of digital and solving environmental and societal concerns.

The convergence of leadership, technological innovation, and business strategy will take place at the Gartner IT Symposium/XpoTM 2022 conference. The information presented will provide attendees with insights into the path that technology is likely to take in the future, best practices for defining and validating their IT strategy, and examples from the real world on how to carry out important initiatives.

In order to discuss important issues including advancing digital business, the future of work, data, analytics, and artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, executive leadership, and more, CIOs and IT executives will gather in Barcelona, Spain.

Gartner Data & Analytics Summit 2022

Instead of a “new normal,” enterprises are moving toward a “no normal” – a climate of ambiguity and unpredictability that necessitates constant adaptability, innovation, and investment in data and analytics strategy. Data and analytics are increasingly essential to corporate strategy and significantly enhance efforts to implement digital transformation.

The most important issues that data analytics leaders confront as they create the forward-thinking, flexible enterprises of the future are covered at the Gartner Data & Analytics Summit.

Join now to discover how to:

Utilize data and analytics to unlock the extraordinary potential of people, strategy, and technology for releasing creativity and continually adapting to change. -Deliver ongoing value in an unpredictable environment with strategies and innovations underpinned by data and analytics.
Utilize modern data analytics to streamline corporate decision-making in a challenging and unpredictable environment.
Utilize data and analytics as effective tools to promote innovation and manage change to transform uncertainty into opportunity.

Gartner IT Symposium/XPO Japan 2022

The Gartner IT Symposium/XPO 2022 is a conference that will bring together a variety of perspectives on topics including business strategy, technological innovation, and leadership. The attendees will be provided with insights and expert counsel on the future directions for technology, best practices in designing and validating IT strategy, examples of execution of significant initiatives, and more.

CIOs and other experts in the information technology field will get together in Tokyo to address important subjects such as the acceleration of digital businesses, the future of work, data, analytics, and artificial intelligence; executive leadership; and cybersecurity.

Gartner Identity & Access Management Summit 2023

Security and the operation of your organization, from remote work to client access, both depend on identity. Organizations now operate in a threat environment where the perimeter has become porous and zero trust is no longer an option, making conventional approaches to identity and access management (IAM) insufficient.

By putting identity-based controls at the center of your organization’s protection architecture and enhancing threat detection and response capabilities, you can adopt an identity-first security strategy. The 2023 Gartner Identity & Access Management Summit assists IAM and security leaders in making informed choices regarding which identity-first security initiatives to prioritize, how to update current staffing models, and whether to purchase new tools to transform their organization’s security posture for the identity-first era.

Gartner CIO Leadership Forum UK 2023

In a period of constant upheaval, the position of the CIO is rapidly evolving. CIOs must broaden their impact to lead IT beyond the function, collaborating with colleagues in the C-suite to advance digital business models, enabling the future of work, and driving business success.

CIOs can maximize their impact and lead digital business acceleration by attending the Gartner CIO Leadership Forum 2023, which provides professional counsel, actionable tools, and CIO peer perspectives.

The team invites you to apply for this private conference for CIOs, which has been carefully chosen to provide insights and ideas that will reenergize you as a leader.

Gartner Data & Analytics Summit Florida 2023

Organizations all across the world are utilizing the actual power of data and analytics methods to maximize decision-making during this period of constant change. It is your responsibility as chief data and analytics officer (CDAO) and your team to scale integrated ecosystems across your enterprise while leveraging AI to properly manage data and privacy. In the face of an ever-changing global environment, you’ll need to lead your team with purpose, combining trust, responsibility, governance, and security with agility and responsiveness. Adopting a human-centered approach to talent acquisition and retention will be key to your success.

Attend the Gartner Data & Analytics Summit in 2023.

Join the team at the Gartner Data and Analytics Conference in Florida, where they will deliver solutions to the most pressing issues you face. This will prepare you to establish and empower the future’s inventive and flexible organizations.

To handle disruption, and implement strategies and innovations underpinned by data, analytics, and data science.

Gartner Identity & Access Management Summit Texas 2023

Identification is fundamental to cybersecurity and corporate operations, from remote work to consumer access. Traditional approaches to identity and access management (IAM) are no longer adequate in a rising threat environment where the perimeter has become weak and zero trust is no longer an option.

Implementing an identity-first security philosophy entails putting identity-based controls at the center of your organization’s protection architecture and expanding threat detection and response capabilities. The Gartner Identity & Access Management Summit 2023, being held in Texas, assists IAM and security leaders in making informed decisions about which identity-first security initiatives to prioritize, how to modernize existing staffing models, and whether to invest in new tools to transition their organization’s security posture into the identity-first era.

Gartner Security & Risk Management Summit Australia 2023

Modern organizations’ ever-expanding digital footprint is posing new security challenges. The pandemic reaction has pushed hybrid work and cloud-based digitalization of business processes. Meanwhile, major game ransomware attacks, several attacks on the digital supply chain, deeply ingrained vulnerabilities, and increased attacks on identification systems occurred last year. These accumulating security issues are exacerbated by a scarcity of trained security personnel at all levels. Several elements influence how security and risk management leaders:

Adapt their organization’s security practices to stay up with business demands and an ever-changing threat landscape.
Discover the best balance between their dual missions of protecting their organization and demonstrating the value of cybersecurity as a strategic business enabler.

The Gartner Security & Risk Management Symposium assists security and risk management leaders in evolving their positions in order to face future challenges and enhance their standing within their enterprises.

As digital business transformation sweeps the workplace and “digital” becomes a need for every task, security, and risk professionals must act as change agents, promoting secure digital transformation. More Information On Their Events

The Horizon 2020 EU projects GUARD, RAINBOW, SIMARGL, PALANTIR, INSPIRE-5GPlus, and SIFIS-HOME are working together to organize the 4th International Workshop on Cyber-Security in Software-defined and Virtualized Infrastructures (SecSoft) on July 1, 2022, with the goal of fostering discussion about new cyber-security paradigms for virtualized environments and crucial infrastructures.

ICT services and infrastructures are gradually changing as a result of changing business models, a growing trend, the widespread use of virtualization paradigms, and a close connection to the physical world. Unfortunately, the advancement of cyber-security paradigms has not proceeded at the same rate, creating a significant vacuum in available protections for the new varieties of distributed and heterogeneous systems against a changing cyber-threat scenario.

Antivirus software, intrusion prevention systems, and firewalls, which enterprises have long used to safeguard their networks, are no longer able to offer adequate security guarantees against the rapidly escalating sophistication of advanced persistent threats and multi-vector attacks. It is critically necessary to increase the spatial and temporal correlation of (pretending to be) independent events and logs, as well as the level of coordination between various security systems, due to the complexity of cyberattacks.

This session seeks to bring together cutting-edge methods for giving businesses the necessary situational awareness regarding cyber security risks so they can promptly identify and successfully counteract complex cyberattacks.

More Information On Their Events

The IEEE Computer Society is the leading source of computer science and engineering knowledge, inspiration, and cooperation. The Computer Society, which has members all across the world, enables people who develop technology by providing tools for people at all stages of their careers. International conferences, peer-reviewed papers, a large digital library, globally recognized standards, and chances for ongoing learning are among their valued resources.

The IEEE Computer Society advances the theory, design, practice, and application of computer and information-processing science and technology, as well as the professional standing of its members, as the world’s leading membership organization dedicated to computer science and technology.

In 2022, in Italy, Genova the IEEE Euro S&P will be taking place.

The SILM workshop’s goal is to discuss experiences, tools, and approaches for dealing with security in software/hardware interfaces. On the one hand, the organizers say that we all need to improve our understanding of the security assurances given by existing hardware architectures against software assaults, particularly those targeting micro-architecture. This can be accomplished by discovering new vulnerabilities using reverse engineering, fuzzing, or other attack methods. On the other side, we must suggest new designs that are more resilient to software threats. To safeguard the software stack, these designs should rely on hardware-based security methods. Formally describing and proving the security assurances provided by such systems is one of the issues.

This third edition of the SILM workshop aims to provide a venue for academics and practitioners working on the security of software/hardware interfaces from academia, business, and government.

2022 IEEE International Conference on Cyber Security and Resilience

Complex Cyber-Physical Systems (CPSs) have brought about a technological and industrial revolution, but they have also brought with them new risks and cyber-attacks that take advantage of their inherent complexity and heterogeneity. Cyber resilience, or a combination of tactics, methodologies, and approaches that enable complex CPS adaptive capability during cyber-attacks, should be shown by systems under assault.

The conference will focus on theoretical and practical elements of network, system, and service security, privacy, trust, and resilience, as well as creative approaches to coping with vulnerabilities and mitigating sophisticated cyber-attacks.

ACM/IEEE International Conference on Human-Robot Interaction (HRI) 2022

HRI 2022 is the 17th annual conference on human-robot interaction research, both basic and applied. Researchers from all around the globe exhibit their finest work at HRI in order to share ideas regarding theory, technology, data, and research that advances the state-of-the-art in human-robot interaction.

The Human-Robot Interaction (HRI) conference is a highly selective annual international conference that aims to showcase the best interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary research in human-robot interaction with roots in and broad participation from communities such as robotics, artificial intelligence, human-computer interaction, human factors, design, and social and behavioral sciences, among others.

Each year, the HRI Conference features a theme that focuses on a certain topic. “Breaking Boundaries” is the theme of HRI 2022.

IEEE IAS Global Conference on Emerging Technologies (GlobConET) 2022

IEEE IAS Global Conference on Emerging Technologies (GlobConET) will be held in virtual form on May 20-21, 2022, with full financial support from the IEEE Industry Applications Society in the United States.

GlobConET will bring together practical engineers, academics, and researchers in a platform to address a variety of topics and the future direction of various Emerging Technologies. The conference seeks to bring together specialists from many fields to share their expertise and experience in preparation for future study. IEEE Industry Application Society USA is the sole financial sponsor of the conference, while ten premier universities from across the world are providing technical support. The conference has ten tracks that cover practically every aspect of Emerging Technologies.

Conference Tracks:

Track I. Smart Cities
Track II. Renewable Energy technologies including hydrogen

There will be presentations on cutting-edge research in biometrics, forensic science, surveillance, and multimedia forensics. The 10th International Workshop on Biometrics in Forensic Applications (IWBF) will bring together experts from business, academia, and end-users to discuss the use of sophisticated biometric technology in forensic applications.

IEEE International Conference on Smart Information Systems and Technologies (IEEE SIST) 2022

The following research areas are covered by the 2022 IEEE International Conference on Smart Information Systems and Technologies (2022 IEEE SIST): Technology and Engineering Management, Governance, Finance, and Economy; IT in Education and Research; Emerging Trends and Technologies in IT Application; Data Science and Advanced Analytics.

IEEE Kazakhstan Sub-Section will be a technical co-sponsor of the conference. The IEEE SIST International Conference in 2022 will be a key event in Kazakhstan’s scientific community, attracting business leaders, scientists, researchers, professionals, and students from many fields of the IT sector from near and far. IEEE Workshop on 5G & Beyond Wireless Security (Wireless-Sec) 2022

Future wireless systems will necessitate a paradigm shift in how they are networked, structured, configured, optimized, and automatically recovered based on their operational conditions. People, data, processes, and objects are all being brought together in the new Internet of Things (IoT) and Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) applications to meet our daily demands. Adaptive services and applications are gaining popularity as software-defined networks arise, as they enable the automatic setup of devices and their parameters, systems, and services in response to changes in the user’s context.

The future Fifth Generation and Beyond (5G&B) wireless networks, which are more than just a 4G upgrade, are projected to form the backbone of IoT and CPS, supporting IoT systems by expanding coverage, lowering latency, and increasing data rate. However, providing durable connectivity to accommodate the huge number of frequently resource-constrained IoT and other wireless devices has various obstacles. As a result, existing communication protocols and techniques are not suited owing to various unique aspects of new applications, such as low latency, low cost, low energy consumption, and robust and dependable connections.

Given the limits imposed by heterogeneous IoT and CPS systems, it is critical to have security by design in 5G and Beyond wireless networks. Their goal is to promote 5G security via design development. Wireless-Security 2022, a planned INFOCOM workshop, will provide a place for academics from academia, government, and industry to share ideas, present new discoveries, and provide future perspectives on these themes.

IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy (SP) 2022

The IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy has been the leading platform for presenting and bringing together scholars and practitioners on the subject of computer security and electronic privacy since 1980. The Symposium in 2022 will be the main conference’s 43rd annual gathering.

IEEE Data Science and Learning Workshop (DSLW) 2022

On May 22-23, 2022, the IEEE Data Science & Learning Workshop (DSLW 2022), which will be organized in conjunction with ICASSP 2022, will be hosted at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in Singapore. The IEEE Signal Processing Society is hosting the workshop (supported by the SPS Data Science Initiative).

The SPS Data Science Initiative envisions and implements DSLW 2022 as a workshop with a low acceptance rate. Its goal is to bring together academic and industrial experts to discuss the most recent and intriguing developments in data science and machine learning theory and applications.

The workshop will include cutting-edge data science and learning research from a variety of academic fields, including signal processing, statistics, machine learning, data mining, and computer vision. Both theoretical and methodological foundational research is encouraged.

IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (CNS)

On September 26-28, 2022, the tenth annual IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (IEEE CNS) will be conducted both in-person and remotely in Austin, Texas. IEEE CNS is a prominent venue for security researchers, practitioners, policymakers, and users to communicate ideas, strategies, and tools, as well as raise awareness and share experiences relating to all practical and theoretical elements of cybersecurity.

Original high-quality technical papers from academia, government, and business are sought for IEEE CNS 2022. From the physical layer through the network layer to the range of applications depending on a secure communication substrate, topics of interest include all practical and theoretical elements of communications and network security.

IEEE International Symposium on Circuits and Systems (ISCAS) 2022

The IEEE International Symposium on Circuits and Systems (ISCAS) is the IEEE Circuits and Systems Society’s flagship conference and the world’s top platform for researchers working on circuits and systems theory, design, and implementation. Technical conference sessions, poster sessions, live demonstration sessions, and the publication of conference papers are all used to accomplish this. The subject of ISCAS 2022 will be Emerging issues in intelligent, omnipresent, autonomous, mobile devices, with the goal of promoting transdisciplinary solutions to today’s social and engineering difficulties.

ISCAS 2022 will take place from May 28 to June 1 in Austin, Texas. Austin is one of the United States’ fastest-growing cities. The fast-developing IT industry in the Austin metropolitan region is responsible for most of this expansion. The conference will be able to have a significant industry representation due to the vast and vibrant IT sector.

IEEE 95th Vehicular Technology Conference 2022

The IEEE 95th Vehicular Technology Conference: VTC2022-Spring will be held from 19-22 June 2022 in Helsinki, Finland. This IEEE Vehicular Technologies Society’s flagship conference will bring together experts from academia, government, and business to discuss and exchange ideas in the domains of wireless, mobile, and vehicular technology.

World-class plenary speakers, tutorials, technical and application sessions, and a unique Industry Track will feature panels and talks with industry professionals offering their thoughts on the latest technology.

IEEE Cloud Summit 2022

The IEEE Cloud Summit is a one-of-a-kind international forum for researchers, developers, and practitioners to present cutting-edge research and best practices, as well as to exchange ideas and perspectives on current trends and technical challenges in Cloud, Fog, Internet of Things, and Edge Computing, as well as their applications for societal benefit.

The IEEE Technical Committee on Cloud Computing (TCCLD) is hosting the IEEE Cloud Summit 2022 at George Mason University in Fairfax, Virginia.

The conference agenda includes an industrial track and tutorials on cloud, fog, and big data techniques (AWS, Spark, MapReduce, and others), as well as their applications in industries, delivered by industry professionals. The conference will provide networking opportunities for cloud and fog computing stakeholders from across the world.

The IEEE Computer Society’s Conference Publishing Services (CPS) will publish all approved and presented papers/poster abstracts in the conference proceedings, which will be available in IEEE Xplore.

IEEE International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems (IEEE ITSC) 2022

The 25th IEEE International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems (IEEE ITSC 2022) is the IEEE Intelligent Transportation Systems Society’s annual flagship conference. The IEEE ITSC 2022 conference encourages papers and talks in the fields of intelligent transportation systems and autonomous driving that transmit significant advancements and developments in theory, modeling, simulation, testing, case studies, and large-scale implementation.

Prospective writers are especially encouraged to discuss their new research work, findings, insights, and advancements relevant to advanced blockchain-based intelligent transportation systems at the conference.

International System-on-Chip Conference (SOCC) 2022

The core of computing and communication, entertainment, medical, and logistical technologies powering the burgeoning “Digital Societies” is System on Chip (SoC) devices, which include digital, analog, optical, RF, and Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS).

Recent advancements in systems, packaging, and manufacturing technologies have made it possible to compute hundreds of teraflops per chip, paving the way for a flood of AI-enabled devices and applications. Storage, memory, security, reliability, power, on-chip communication, packaging, and design and verification management all face new issues as a result of the great need for integration and processing per square millimeter of silicon.

The IEEE International System-on-Chip Conference (SOCC) has been the leading platform for presenting the most recent advances in SoC architecture, systems, logic, circuit design, process technology, test, design tools, and applications for over 35 years. With the 2022 conference, we proudly continue this legacy in Belfast, Northern Ireland, the birthplace of the Titanic.

The 35th SOCC will feature a three-day technical program that will include keynote and plenary lectures, oral and poster presentations, hot-topic panel discussions, and two days of industry talks. Furthermore, SOCC has a long history of high-end social activities that complement the technical program by allowing you to discuss your work with your peers and expand your professional network.

International Conference on Blockchain (Blockchain 2022)

Blockchain has been successfully used to digital money, such as bitcoin, as a public record for transactions as a potential mechanism for achieving decentralized consensus. Its safe design for enabling a distributed computing system with excellent fault tolerance is gaining worldwide interest. By effectively creating confidence among people and machines, cutting expenses, and enhancing resource utilization, blockchain has the ability to lay new foundations for our socio-economic systems. On the one hand, blockchain will be critical for secure decentralization in sectors like the Internet of Things, Cyber-Physical Systems, edge computing, social networking, crowdsourcing, next-generation wireless communications, and many more. Scalability, security, privacy, efficiency, adaptability, availability, true decentralization, and high reliability, on the other hand, need to be further developed.

Following the success of IEEE Blockchain 2021 in Melbourne, Australia, IEEE Blockchain 2020 in Rhodes Island, Greece, IEEE Blockchain 2019 in Atlanta, USA, and IEEE Blockchain 2018 in Halifax, Canada, the 2022 IEEE International Conference on Blockchain (Blockchain-2022) will provide a high-profile, cutting-edge forum for researchers, engineers, and practitioners to present the latest advances and innovations in key theories, infrastructure, schemes, and technologies.

International Workshop on Traffic Measurements for Cybersecurity (WTMC) 2022

Due to reasons such as massive expansion in the number of network users, continual emergence of network applications, a rising quantity of data exchanged, and diversity of user behaviors, current communication networks are becoming increasingly widespread, complicated, and ever-evolving. Understanding and evaluating traffic in such networks is a challenging but necessary task not just for network administration but also, more recently, for cybersecurity. For example, network traffic measurement and monitoring may aid in the study of malicious software distribution and capabilities, as well as the understanding of the nature of various network threats, such as those that exploit users’ behavior and other user’s sensitive information. On the other hand, network traffic analysis can assist assess the performance of existing countermeasures or contribute to the development of new, more effective ones. Recently, traffic measures have been used in the field of cybersecurity economics, for example, to assess ISP “badness” or to estimate cyber-criminal earnings.

The goal of this workshop is to bring together the research accomplishments of academic and industrial professionals. Another purpose is to present the most up-to-date research findings in the field of cybersecurity and to comprehend how traffic measurements might affect it. Prospective writers are encouraged to submit related noteworthy research articles on the topics of both theoretical approaches and practical case reviews. This session will highlight some of the most important ongoing cybersecurity research from the standpoint of traffic metrics.

Non-experts interested in learning more about this field as well as specialists interested in hearing about new research and ideas will be able to attend the session.

On October 19, 2022, in Oklahoma City, United States of America, as well as online, the VizSec 2022 conference will be hosted in conjunction with the hybrid IEEE VIS Conference. VizSec is a conference that brings together scholars and practitioners in the fields of information visualization and security. The conference’s goal is to meet the particular demands of the cyber security community by utilizing innovative and informative visualization approaches.

It also celebrates the 800th anniversary of its university (1545).

The Symposium will offer the chance to examine the latest findings and trends on connected, highly interdisciplinary themes, as well as to bring together complementing abilities from many sectors.

International Conference on Consumer Electronics (IEEE ICCE) 2023

In conjunction with the Consumer Electronics Show (CES), the 41st IEEE International Conference on Consumer Electronics (ICCE 2023) will take place. International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Information and Communication (ICAIIC) 2023

We have seen rapid advancements in numerous artificial intelligence (AI) technologies, and many types of information and communication systems that use AI are becoming essential components of our daily lives. There is an increasing interest in information and communication technology (ICT) with AI as future information, communication, and electronic devices proliferate.

The conference encourages their practical application in the development of intelligent ICT systems and the pursuit of artificial intelligence applications for contents, platforms, networks, and devices. The Fifth International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Information and Communication (ICAIIC 2023) intends to address developments in ICT research, covering subjects spanning from ICT technological concerns to developing AI applications for ICTs.

ICAIIC 2023 invites original, unpublished submissions in all areas of artificial intelligence in information and communication. Articles submitted must not be considered for publication elsewhere at the same time. We also urge authors to submit brief papers on ongoing research or development that presents significant new difficulties. Position papers on innovative ideas, as well as industry papers, are invited.

The conference will be held in Bali, Indonesia, and will be held virtually. It is organized by the KICS (The Korean Institute of Communications and Information Sciences) Artificial Intelligence Society, with technical support from the IEEE Communications Society and IEICE-CS. Accepted and presented papers will be published with an ISBN number in the ICAIIC Conference Proceedings and submitted to IEEE Xplore, Scopus, and EI Compendex. Additionally, longer versions of chosen papers will be published as a special issue for the ICAIIC 2023 in the following international publications.

IEEE Region 3 holds its annual Technical, Professional, and Student Conference in conjunction with SoutheastCon.

With the use of technical sessions, tutorials, and displays, it brings together professionals in the fields of Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, and Computer Engineering, as well as academic faculty and students, to exchange the most recent knowledge. It is the most important conference in Region 3 for raising public awareness of the technological contributions that our industry has made to the development of engineering research and to the betterment of the community.

Attendance and participation in the technical programme from places outside of IEEE Region 3 are encouraged and welcomed, as is customary and expected. The area known as the southeastern United States is known as IEEE Region 3, and it is comprised of the states of Alabama, Florida, and Georgia, as well as portions of the states of Indiana, Kentucky, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Virginia, as well as the island nation of Jamaica.

IEEE International Conference on Smart Information Systems and Technologies (IEEE SIST) 2023

The following research areas will be covered at the 2023 IEEE International Conference on Smart Information Systems and Technologies (2023 IEEE SIST), but this list is not exhaustive: Technology and Engineering Management, Governance, Finance, and Economy; Information Technology (IT) in Education and Research; Emerging Trends and Technologies in Information Technology Application; Data Science and Advanced Analytics.

The Ukraine Section of IEEE will be participating as a technical co-sponsor of the conference. The 2023 IEEE SIST International Conference is a key event in the scientific community of Kazakhstan. It will bring together business executives, scientists, researchers, specialists, and students from a variety of subfields within the information technology industry from all over the world. People are able to share their experiences with one another at this conference, as well as grow and broaden their knowledge as well as their viewpoints on specific themes, broaden their professional networks, and contribute to the finding of answers to some questions regarding recent trends in IT. It is possible that the conference will act as a jumping-off point for ideas about the implementation of government initiatives and the subsequent development and research efforts.

IoT&Security 2023 : 2nd International Workshop on IoT and Security @ IEEE DASC 2023

Because of the expansion of IoT devices in ordinary human life, their security has become a key requirement. Currently, those devices are not very secure for a variety of reasons. For starters, manufacturers do not prioritize security, producing goods that are open to attacks, leaving users with security concerns that are unlikely to be rectified. Second, many IoT devices lack the computer ability to run an antivirus or do not allow it to be installed.

Finally, the heterogeneity of the IoT in terms of apps, hardware, and software broadens the attack surface while increasing the difficulty of adopting all-encompassing security solutions. Despite the security provided by IoT enabling technologies (e.g., communication protocols) or intrusion prevention systems (e.g., network firewalls), attackers continue to develop ways to compromise devices or their communication.

Unlike laptop and desktop computers, which have periodic on-off cycles, many IoT devices, such as webcams and wireless routers, work unsupervised 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

As a result, IoT devices are particularly vulnerable to various assaults, such as those aimed at recruiting devices for botnets. As a result, IoT networks are not only harmful for themselves but also for remote systems that are targets of assaults launched by infected IoT devices. Furthermore, IoT-based systems that handle sensitive data (for example, healthcare IS) must respond quickly to malicious activity in order to prevent private data from exiting the network.

As a result, IoT networks must have some form of security mechanism, such as intrusion detection systems, intrusion prevention systems, attack reaction systems, proactive defense mechanisms, and so on.

The main topics include but are not limited to:

Intrusion Detection Systems
Malware/Botnet detection
Security for VANETS/MANETS
Security for IoT-based systems (industrial control, healthcare monitoring, Cyber Physical Systems, domotic)
Security for cloud-based IoT applications
Security at the edge/fog
Attack detection and countermeasures
Game theory for the IoT security
Security resources placement strategies
Security for software defined IoT networks
Security for narrowband IoT networks
Security for SCADA-based systems
IoT firmware analysis
Automatic exploit generation for IoT devices
Side channel attacks for IoT devices
Cryptography for IoT
Tamperproofing techniques for IoT

More Information On Their Events

Also referred to as Asociación @aslan, this is the organizer behind these events. They are based in Madrid, Spain.

ASLAN 2022

ASLAN2022 will provide a comprehensive view of the latest developments in information technology (IT) innovation and cybersecurity made by leading manufacturers and specialized technology partners, as well as the experiences of CIOs/CTOs/CISOs who are leading digitization projects in key sectors such as the health industry, industry, or transportation, and all the news on the opportunities offered by European recovery funds to develop the full potential of technologies such as 5G or artificial intelligence.

The following are some of the subjects that will be covered at the meeting:

Data
Cyber Security
Digital Workspace
Cloud Datacenter
Intelligent Networks

ASLAN 2023

The @aslan Association, which represents 173 manufacturers and suppliers specializing in digital innovation and cybersecurity, will host the thirtieth edition of the ASLAN2023 Madrid Congress & EXPO on March 22 and 23 at the IFEMA Convention Center under the title “We will keep innovating. We continue forward.”

A fantastic yearly event in Madrid that will bring together over 7,500 people interested in technologies to drive the digital revolution.

Cybersecurity, hybrid infrastructures, advanced analytics, data centers, and other technologies are required to propel the digital economy forward. We are witnessing an extraordinary paradigm shift in which companies and governments prioritize technology. The resilience capability, as well as the ability to provide better services and meet the enormous challenges of this decade, is in the hands of digital transformation teams.

This edition will cover current topics such as:

Digitization and securitization of critical sectors for economic recovery and competitiveness enhancement.
The impact of AI, 5G, and automation on digital infrastructures.
The ICT distribution channel is a force for advancing SMEs’ digitization.
The AGE and Territory Public Administration’s modernization and digitization challenge.
The possibility of growing the national cybersecurity managed services business.
Data centers and connectivity, a chance to cement Madrid and Spain as a digital hub for southern Europe.
Improving connectivity and digital infrastructures through strategic Next Generation Funds projects.

Proud to recommend one of our partners: The Australian Cyber Conference in Melbourne!

More Information On Their Events

The GSMA is a worldwide organization dedicated to uniting the mobile ecosystem in order to find, develop, and deliver innovation that is critical to good business and societal change.

The GSMA serves its members through three major pillars: Industry Services and Solutions, Connectivity for Good, and Outreach, and the organization represent mobile operators and organizations across the mobile ecosystem and related sectors.

Connectivity for Good (one of their main campaigns) brings together members, governments, and civil society to drive beneficial policy and spectrum results, foster digital innovation to alleviate global inequities, and address today’s most pressing social issues like digital inclusion, climate change, and sustainability.

The technology and interoperability that make mobile functions are supported by Industry Services and Solutions. They assist the industry’s attention on issues like 5G, Mobile IoT, fraud, and security through their initiatives, working groups, and promotional efforts.

And their technical services provide tools, data, and resources to help users have even more efficient and reliable mobile experiences. MWC Barcelona, Shanghai, Los Angeles, and the M360 series are some of the world’s biggest conferences aimed at uniting and enlightening the mobile ecosystem, as well as providing breaking news, insights, and expert analysis through Mobile World Live and GSMA Intelligence.

MWC Barcelona and 4YFN are returning in 2022 with increased vigor.

As one of the world’s largest and most prominent connectivity events is planned, over 1,500 exhibitors and guests from 150 countries are expected to participate.

MWC Barcelona 2023

There is only one location to keep up in a rapidly shifting innovation ecosystem and turn radical disruption into radical growth. So come join us at the world’s largest and most prominent connectivity event.

MWC Barcelona, Spain, brings together three critical drivers in our industry: technology, community, and commerce.

It’s where 5G meets global affairs. Immersive technology connects industry. And tiny enterprises connect with tech behemoths.

It’s also where you’ll hear the year’s most significant arguments, produces a year’s worth of leads in four days, and help design a better tomorrow.

Velocity will prioritize growth, relationships, and positive change. We can’t wait to see you as we explore new methods to bring tomorrow’s innovation to the globe today as a mobile-enabled ecosystem.

MWC Las Vegas 2023

The GSMA’s aim is to unleash the full power of connectivity so that individuals, industry, and society can thrive. The GSMA’s flagship event in North America, MWC Las Vegas, Nevada, is co-hosted by CTIA and showcases the latest trends in connectivity and mobile innovation. This is where the ecology comes face to face in order to form strong bonds. And it is here that they will apply their collective knowledge to accelerate technology and propel human growth. This is where the mobile ecosystem, technology sector, and vertical industries affected by connectivity come to investigate the topics that shape our world.

From carriers and equipment manufacturers to mobile app developers and content providers, the team represents the North American wireless communications industry.

In 2022, they will investigate their theme, Connectivity Unleased. It is the place where North America does business by displaying the latest technology, thought leadership, and cutting-edge exhibitors.

Prepare to repair, reinvent, and reconnect at the industry’s most powerful connectivity event.

MWC Shanghai 2023

Certainly one of the more interesting cybersecurity conferences in China.

MWC Shanghai is the most important connectivity event in Asia. It is a platform where world-leading companies and trailblazers exchange the most recent thought leadership on the evolution and future of connection. It’s also the greatest venue to network with mobile and tech industry influencers.

Global mobile operators, device manufacturers, technology providers, suppliers, and content owners will all be present at MWC Shanghai. It is the place to be seen, exhibit cutting-edge products and technology, and build exceptional connections with senior industry decision-makers, inventors, and innovators.

Proud to recommend one of our partners: The Australian Cyber Conference in Melbourne!
